intro: Lorentzia cordobensis, commonly known as the Cordoba morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces violet to purple blooms that open in the early morning, hence its common name. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Lorentzia cordobensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in a variety of soil types with adequate sunlight.
